title: Helpline to help parents of troubled Muslim youths | Daily Mail Online
text: Anti-terror hotline: Phone service launched to help parents of troubled Muslim youths to prevent them from becoming radicalised A unique helpline launched to help Muslim parents of troubled youths The trained counsellors will be available seven days a week It will help parents of youths combat all issues including radicalisation Published: 23:32 GMT, 19 February 2017 | Updated: 23:47 GMT, 19 February 2017 139 shares comments Trained counsellors are setting up the first helpline for parents of troubled Muslim youths to combat bullying, drinking and drug abuse and even radicalisation. The helpline, which will operate from 9am to midnight, was set up by Kuranda Seyit to help parents guide their children through issues faced in society. Accompanied by the website Islamicare.org.au , trained Muslim counsellors will offer a specific service to help support families and children in difficult times. Islamicare is the accompanying website to the seven day a week helpline for Muslim parents seeking guidance to help their children deal with problems The helpline will be run by trained counsellors to guide parents seeking help (Stock Image) Mr Seyit said what makes this helpline special is the operators will not only have training but the resources to refer on children to services and intervene if needed. 'This is unique,' Mr Seyit told the ABC . 'We have so many issues now facing our youth, and it's easy to blame parents but they need support, they need the tools and encouragement to deal with their children in a pragmatic and rational way.' The website Islamicare describes the helpline as the 'first port of call' for parents to directly speak to professionals. The helpline is designed for parents but is available for children (Stock Image) RELATED ARTICLES
